page.title: 03Portsmouth South By-Election
page.content: In 1979 the Conservatives won {Portsmouth North}and{South},and still control the City Council. In the 1984 by-election{Portsmouth South}surprised many by electing{Mike Hancock (SDP). Why were the major parties rejected? The{Tories}defeated themselves: the government had announced plans to close the naval dockyard, while their candidate from London seemed not to know the difference between Portsmouth South and Portsmouth North. Disaster struck{Labour.}Its national leadership was in disorder, as was the local party since many of the leaders had joined the SDP. Mr.Hancock says he was elected because others lost. But many saw it as a victory for{the popular local man who knew his city well. -Martin Buckle Portsmouth Grammar School
